intro: Whipplea utahensis, commonly known as the Utah whipplea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It has hairy, ovate leaves and thrives in well-drained soils in arid environments. Whipplea utahensis is often found in rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
